FuncDef:
The monitor qos-profile statistics command monitors QoS profile statistics, including statistics about various services in user queues.
By default, the function is not configured.
CLIs: monitor qos-profile statistics interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } [ vlan <vlan-id> | pe-vid <pe-vid> ce-vid <ce-vid> | vid <vid> | ce-vid <ce-vid> | vid <vid> ce-vid <ce-vid> ] { inbound | outbound } [ interval <seconds> ] [ repeat <repeat> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the VLAN ID of packets whose QoS statistics you want to check.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the PE VLAN ID (value of the outer tag) of packets whose statistics you want to check.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the CE VLAN ID (value of the inner tag) of packets whose statistics you want to check.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the VLAN ID of packets whose statistics you want to check.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Indicates the inbound direction of an interface.
-

Indicates the outbound direction of an interface.
-

Specifies intervals at which statistics are monitored.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 60, in seconds. The default value is 10.

Specifies the number of monitoring attempts.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 999, in times. The default value is 10.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> monitor qos-profile statistics interface GigabitEthernet1/0/0.1 vlan 100 inbound
Display qos-profile statistics of the interface at the interval of 3 seconds for up to 2 times. Press Ctrl + C to stop.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display qos-profile statistics command displays statistics about various services in user queues. The monitor qos-profile statistics command allows you to check statistics about various services in user queues at intervals for specific times.
